page.title: 03HISTORY OF ST ERME CHURCH
page.content: There is mention of a church in St Erme in the original Domesday book.It was in the manor of Alwin.The style and openings in the southern wall of the church suggest it is of Saxon origin.When a church was first built on the site must be open to conjecture. During the 18 century St Erme church fell into disrepair,like so many other churches in the country.During the reign of George 111 the church was rebuilt. In 1905 the church underwent a further rebuilding. During early 1985 the parish of St. Erme was incorporated into the team ministry of Probus.One member of the team, Rev.A.Wright,had moved into a house on the new estate during 1984.
